name: Family History
footer: Unless otherwise mentioned, all questions are sourced from the All of Us research study.

questionTemplates.name: oh_oh_famHx_ageAtHeartAttack
questionTemplates.title: How old was this person when the heart attack occurred?

choices.text: Pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis

questionTemplates.title: What is the sex of this person?

questionTemplates.title: What is the age of this person?

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_intro
elements.html:
This survey asks you about your family’s medical history. You will be shown a list of conditions and asked to select those that certain family members have or had. Understanding your family’s experiences with medical issues can tell us a lot about what kinds of medical issues might be related to your genetics. Genetics has to do with traits that are passed down from generation to generation in a family.

For these next few questions, please answer with your family members' biological sex in mind. We define an individual's biological sex as male, female, or intersex. Biological sex is often assigned at birth and associated with chromosomes and physical attributes such as anatomy. Someone who is intersex might be assigned from birth or they might not know until later in life.

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_knowledgeIntro
elements.html:
Family Health Knowledge

Think only of people you are related to by blood including those living or deceased. Before asking a comprehensive family history, we will ask you about some of the most serious cardiac conditions that can run in families.

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_famKnowledge
elements.title: Please select the blood-related family members whose medical history you can provide.

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_famKnowledge_numSiblings
elements.title: Please choose the number of siblings you are able to provide information about. If you have more than 4 siblings, please complete survey pages for the 4 siblings you know most about.

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_famKnowledge_numChildren
elements.title: Please choose the number of biological children you are able to provide information about. If you have more than 4 children, please complete survey pages for the 4 children you know most about.

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_conditionIntro
elements.html:
Family History of Premature Cardiac Disease

Please indicate if ANY of your parents, grandparents, brothers, sisters, and/or children have had any of the following. Think only of the people you are related to by blood. (Please select all that apply. If none of these apply, please skip.)

elements.name: oh_oh_famHx_suddenDeathUnexplained
elements.title: Sudden, unexplained death, before the age of 50 due to non-cardiac related incidents, or those that were unexplained.

choices.text: None of my blood-related family members have had this condition.
